author: Staff Reporter
text:
First Additional District Judge M. Jothiraman handed over life imprisonment to two persons for murdering a security guard and chopping the body and throwing it at different places in 2010.

Kulandai Gounder (60), of Gandhi Nagar in Kannankurichi, was a security guard at an under-construction building in the same area.

On August 28, 2010, after work he did not return home. His son Ezhumalai searched for him in the building and he found blood stains in the floor. He lodged a complaint with the Kannankurichi police. Later a body without head, hands and legs were found in the area.

A surgery mark was found in the body and Ezhumalai identified it as his father. The police picked up Nirmal Kumar (30) and Manikandan (31) of the same area. Inquires revealed that the two went to the building to steal construction materials and Kulandai Gounder raised an alarm.

The two murdered him, chopped the body and threw it at various places and also stole the materials from the premises. All the parts were recovered later.

The judge handed over life sentence to the two for murder and levied fine of Rs. 1,000 each, seven years imprisonment for robbery and fine of Rs. 1,000 each and three years imprisonment for destroying evidence and levied a fine of Rs. 1,000 each. Later, both were taken and lodged at Coimbatore Central Prison.
title: Two get life imprisonment for murder
